instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3481: What is 820-3481? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3478: What is 820-3478? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
Hi there,
I have an Imac LB here that refuses to power on.  I changed out the blade SSD for an M2 and encountered this problem.  Swapped back and the problem persisted.  The Imac was working up to this point.  Have since successfully installed that drive in another Imac.  Tried reseating the processor in its socket but no improvement.  S5 rails are good but all power rails after are pulsing on power button press.
I am using the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematic and boardview as <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A is not available.

Voltages and drop to ground (positive multimeter probe on ground):

Rail                                Voltage                    Drop 

Always on:
<SIGNAL>PP3V_G3</SIGNAL>                       3.3V                          *
<SIGNAL>PP12V_ACDC</SIGNAL>               12.04V                      540
<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL>                 12.04V                      540
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>               3.43V                        319

S5:
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL>                     12.04V                       513
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>                       4.97V                         463
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>                     3.31V                         141

S4:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>                        5V (pulse)               154
<SIGNAL>PP3V2_S4</SIGNAL>                     1.1-3.3V (pulse)      322
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_AP</SIGNAL>               1.1-3.3V (pulse)      322

S3:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_ENET</SIGNAL>                1.1-3.3V (pulse)       375
<SIGNAL>PPVDDQ_S3</SIGNAL>                 1.5V (pulse)             296
<SIGNAL>PPVDDQ_S3_DDR</SIGNAL>       1.5V (pulse)             181

S0:
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL>                     12V (pulse)               443
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_GPUCORE</SIGNAL>  12V (pulse)               446
<SIGNAL>PPHDD12_S0</SIGNAL>                12V (pulse)              612
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_HDD</SIGNAL>           12V (pulse)               611
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_BLC</SIGNAL>             12V (pulse)               501
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_FBVDDQ</SIGNAL>     12V (pulse)              447
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>                         5V (pulse)               379
<SIGNAL>PPHDD_S0</SIGNAL>                     not measured       379           - Only available on back of LB.     
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_HDD</SIGNAL>               0V                            379          - Hard drive not plugged in.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>                       3.3V (pulse)           247
<SIGNAL>PPSSD_S0</SIGNAL>                       3.3V (pulse)           246
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>                        1.48V (pulse)        142
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0_PCH</SIGNAL>              1.5V (pulse)           142
<SIGNAL>PPDDRVTT_S0</SIGNAL>                700mV (pulse)      112
<SIGNAL>PPCPUVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>       1.76V (pulse)        020

GPU:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>         880mV (pulse)     010
<SIGNAL>PPFBVDDQ_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>      1.54V (pulse)       046
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>                      1V (pulse)             061

Thunderbolt:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBTLC</SIGNAL>                 3.3V                       397
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTLC</SIGNAL>               other side             001
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTCIO</SIGNAL>             other side            130


I see there is what looks like a short on a thunderbolt rail <SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTLC</SIGNAL>.  I am not sure whether this would stop the logic board from powering on though.  I put 1V into it and it takes 1 amp however i cannot find any components heating up.  Should i just start pulling capacitors on this rail?  Look forward to your insights as to why this board might not be turning on.  Please let me know if i have missed anything obvious...
thanks from Scotland,
Will

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"<SIGNAL>PP1V05_TBTLC</SIGNAL> other side 001"
Remove <CHIP>U3015</CHIP> and check again; also test if board starts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
Thanks glad to be here!

<CHIP>U3015</CHIP> removed but short still present.  Still not starting...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
Probably bad <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, removed it.

BTW, I'm looking at 3482 schematic.
I hope the mentioned chips have the same position into 3481 board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U2800</CHIP> removed and the short is gone which is good.
I am looking at 3479 schematic....  same apart from gpu area i believe and same board outline.

Still same symptoms.  Do i need <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> to get power good?  Am scanning the board for anything visible...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message:
"I am looking at 3479 schematic"
Do you mean 3478?

So the machine was working untill changed the SSD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message: Sorry yes i meant the 3478 schematic.  Yes it booted with the original blade ssd in it and then i swapped it for the m2 (now in another imac), i got the led2 flickering and swapped back to the original blade and still the same...  Have been scanning the board for missing or damaged components but nothing found yet...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Late 2013 A1419 Imac 1st LED on 2nd LED flickers.
threads.message: If <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> was burnt, possible PCH is damaged too.
